Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, we observed three of three service plan updates reviewed lacked updates to the estimated length of stay.  The children have exceeded the length of stay estimated in the admission assessment.
Correction Narrative: On 1/2/24, the operation submitted corrections indicating they will integrate the DFPS Form K-908-3300 service plan template into their service planning process going forward.  This template includes the requisite time frame updates.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, we observed three of three service plan updates lacked evaluations of effective strategies and goals for the children.  The service plans also lacked evaluation of Normalcy services.
Correction Narrative: On 1/2/24, the operation submitted corrections indicating they will integrate the DFPS Form K-908-3300 service plan template into their service planning process going forward.  This template includes the requisite update information regarding progress and effectiveness of strategies and techniques used to meet identified needs.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, we observed two of three child's rights reviewed lacked documentation of the date reviewed with the child.
Correction Narrative: On 1/2/24, the operation submitted corrections stating expectations for completing the date field of the Child's Rights form was reviewed with staff on 11/26/24 and with Cottage parents on 11/27/24.

Deficiency Narrative: During the Inspection, we observed two of three children's medication logs lacked documentation of the prescribing doctor's information on the form.
Correction Narrative: On 1/2/24, the operation submitted corrections indicating they would utilize updated medication logs including the requisite information which were developed on 11/19/24.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, we observed one of the three children's med log records reviewed lacked the signatures of the administering staff.
Correction Narrative: On 1/2/24, the operation submitted corrections indicating they would utilize updated medication logs including the requisite information which were developed on 11/19/24.

Deficiency Narrative: During the after hours walkthrough, I observed three of four prescription medication logs lacked the reason the medication was prescribed.
Correction Narrative: On 11/19/24, the operation provided me with an updated medication log including a line for the missing Reason For Medication information.  The operation also submitted images of the current med logs with the Reasons for Prescription handwritten in.  The new logs will go into effect as new prescriptions start or when current medications begin a new sheet.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Three of the four employee files read did not contain certificates for Medication of Administration.
Correction Narrative: All updated training certificates were sent and uploaded to document library

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed the refrigerator and freezer in the cottage to be lacking thermometers.  The house parent replaced the thermometers while I was present.
During the inspection, I observed several medication logs to have entries with the initials of an individual administerinig the meds but no full name or signature.
Correction Narrative: On 4/2/24, the operation emailed updated medication logs with the name added to indicate to whom the initials in the cited med logs belonged.  Copies of these logs can be found in Document Library. This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed the professional test for the smoke detectors was six days overdue.
Correction Narrative: On 4/1/24, the operation provided emailed documentation of the smoke detector test having been completed on 3/20/24.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The main vehicle for the cottage did not have a thermometer in the First Aid Kit.
One of the First Aid Kits had numerous packets of medication, which are required to be locked.
The Health and Sanitation inspection was due earlier this month.  The most recent inspection was done on 8/8/2022 .
A caregiver yelled at a foster child on more than one occasion.  He also put his hand on the younger sibling's neck while guiding him to his bedroom.
Correction Narrative: Documentation was sent to me from Administrator, Matt Rogers.  He reiterated what was done with the Litten foster parents after the case started. After extra trainings, coaching, and breaks, Children's Village decided that the Littens were not a good fit for their GRO.  Litten's last day was at the end of June, and they are no longer cottage parents with this operation.  The kids continue to thrive in the other home with the Cottage B parents.

Deficiency Narrative: Three of the four children's records showed that the initial medical exams were done 4, 3, and  2 days late.
Correction Narrative: Mr. Rogers sent me the corrections which had reportedly been done on March 9th.  The new treatment planning forms as well as all the other corrections were uploaded to digital storage and show as compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: On two of the child plans, the implementation date was marked to be 10 days before signatures, and one plan showed an implementation date that was 28 days before the parties signed the plan.
Correction Narrative: Mr. Rogers sent me the corrections which had reportedly been done on March 9th.  The new treatment planning forms as well as all the other corrections were uploaded to digital storage and show as compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: None of the child records showed any documentation that the CPS caseworker was notified at least two weeks in advance of the child's plan meeting.
Correction Narrative: Mr. Rogers sent me the corrections which had reportedly been done on March 9th.  The new treatment planning forms as well as all the other corrections were uploaded to digital storage and show as compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: On one dental exam, the bill and pictures of teeth were in the file, but there was no explanation of what was done or who the Dentist was.
Correction Narrative: Mr. Rogers sent me the corrections which had reportedly been done on March 9th.  The new treatment planning forms as well as all the other corrections were uploaded to digital storage and show as compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection,the operation did not have documentation that the automatic fire alarm system in Cottage A had been tested within the previous 12 months.
Correction Narrative: On 1/16/23, I, Eric Sjerven, received an emailed copy of the fire inspection form signed on 3/14/22 clearly denoting the automatic fire and burglary alarm system had been tested and passed.  This record brings the operation into compliance on this standard.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, it was observed that the freezer in Cottage A did not have a thermometer.
Correction Narrative: On 1/17/23, I, Eric Sjerven, received emailed pictures of the replacement thermometer installed in the freezer.  On 01/16/23, the operation also provided a copy of the receipt for the thermometers by email showing the purchase date as 1/12/23.  This documentation and the associated pictures bring the facility into compliance on this standard and will be located in RCCR digital storage.
